metadata.name: ModuleBuild
metadata.title: New ModuleBuild Project
metadata.description: Create a new PowerShell Module with a ModuleBuild wrapper
metadata.author: Zachary Loeber

parameter.name: ModuleName
parameter.prompt: Enter the name of the module. No space, underscores, or special characters are allowed

parameter.name: ModuleDescription
parameter.prompt: Enter a description of your module

parameter.name: ModuleVersion
parameter.prompt: Enter the version number of the module

parameter.name: ModuleTags
parameter.prompt: Comma separate list of tags that describe this module. This is required for the PowerShell Gallery

parameter.name: AdditionalModulePaths
parameter.prompt: Comma separate list of paths that will be included with the final module release (ie. .\libs,.\data)

parameter.name: PublicFunctionSource
parameter.prompt: Public functions path. This path contains all exportable script code functions for your module

parameter.name: PrivateFunctionSource
parameter.prompt: Private functions path. This path contains all script code not exposed by your module

parameter.name: OtherModuleSource
parameter.prompt: Other module source path. This includes module pre and post load scripts

parameter.name: ScratchFolder
parameter.prompt: Scratch path - this is where all our scratch work occurs. It will be cleared out at every run.

parameter.name: NugetAPIKey
parameter.prompt: Enter a PowerShell Gallery (aka Nuget) API key. Without this you will not be able to upload your module to the Gallery

parameter.name: ProjectLicense
parameter.prompt: What license would you like for this module to have?

choice.label: &Creative Commons
choice.help: This license lets others distribute, remix, tweak, and build upon your work, even commercially, as long as they credit you for the original creation.

choice.label: &MIT
choice.help: A short, permissive software license. Basically, you can do whatever you want as long as you include the original copyright and license notice in any copy of the software/source.

choice.label: &Apache 2.0
choice.help: You can do what you like with the software, as long as you include the required notices. This permissive license contains a patent license from the contributors of the code.

choice.label: &GPL 3.0
choice.help: You may copy, distribute and modify the software as long as you track changes/dates in source files. Any modifications to or software including (via compiler) GPL-licensed code must also be made available under the GPL along with build & install instructions.

parameter.name: OptionAnalyzeCode
parameter.prompt: Use PSScriptAnalyzer in the module build process (Recommended for Gallery uploading)?

parameter.name: OptionCombineFiles
parameter.prompt: Combine scripts into one psm1 in the module build process (Recommended for Gallery uploading)?

parameter.name: OptionSanitizeSensitiveTerms
parameter.prompt: Scan for sensitive terms (like your user id or company domain) in the module build process (Recommended for Gallery uploading)?

parameter.name: OptionGenerateReadTheDocs
parameter.prompt: Generate YML file in build process for ReadTheDocs.org integration?

choice.label: &Yes
choice.help: The YML file will get regenerated at every build. This file gets saved in the root folder of your project.

choice.label: &No
choice.help: No YML file will be generated.
